answerText: tight junction[10] Claudins associate with filaments of this protein on the interior of the cell. This protein and myosin mediate muscle contraction, and it forms helical thin filaments as part of the cytoskeleton.

subject: Science
question: Question: One purpose of these junctions is to preserve apical-basolateral polarity. For 10 points each: [10] Name these cell-cell junctions that are formed by claudins and occludins. They are responsible for gluing epithelial cells together in a watertight sheet.
